result.execSummary:
The defendant Braeden Pierre Glinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CONDITIONS OF PROBATION APPLY TO BOTH COUNTS.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
To pay restitution plus statutorily authorized surcharges if requested.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments including AODA assessment as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol.
Defendant is eligible for expungement under Wis. Stat. 973.015 upon successful completion of Probation and all conditions.

timeConds.notes: STAYED. To be used at courts discretion by petition from DOC.  If probation would be revoked defendant is entitled to 1 day sentence credit.
To perform 30 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Braeden Pierre Glinski

records.addlTxt: 11:23 AM Defendant Braeden Pierre Glinski in court.  Attorney Scott L. Stebbins in court for Braeden Pierre Glinski.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Minute sheet. State moves to amend ct.1. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to ct. 4 & amended ct.1. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of ct.4 & amended ct.1. State/Defense join in sentence recommendation, make statements. Defendant makes statement. Court makes statement, impose sentence. Bond no longer in effect.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 27, 2022 at 11:20 am.

3:10 PM Defendant Braeden Pierre Glinski appeared by video.   Attorney Scott L. Stebbins appeared by video for Braeden Pierre Glinski.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Atty Stebbins requests plea/sentencing date. Bond remains in effect.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 11:20 am.

11:56 AM Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Braeden Pierre Glinski appeared by video.  Attorney Travis A. Crowell appeared by video for Braeden Pierre Glinski. Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.
Arraignment scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 03:10 pm.
Search Warrant, Affidavit, Return of Officer
Status conference on August 4, 2022 at 11:50 am.

8:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Braeden Pierre Glinski in court.  Attorney Scott L. Stebbins in court for Braeden Pierre Glinski. Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waiving time limits for prelim. Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 11:50 am.
Initial appearance on April 25, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 005095,
Payable Number: 100465,
Receipt Number: 22R 002384,
Amount: $20.00

Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol.

1:15PM Braeden Glinski appeared in court by video from the Door County Jail, Shannon Viel appeared by video for Braeden Glinski, Colleen Nordin  appeared in Court for the State.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return May 02, 2022 10:00 AM.
